item.title: Rune Factory: Guardians Of Azuma Latest Update Now Live, Here's What's Included
item.content:encoded:
New features, bug fixes and more

Since the arrival of Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma on the Switch 2 and Switch in June, Marvelous has continued to update the title with additional features and fixes.

Now, to mark the start of October, the team has released a new update worldwide across all platforms, bumping the game up to Version 1.1.0. This latest patch enhances existing features with new additions and once again comes with a bunch of fixes.

Here's the rundown from the official game site:

The Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma 1.1.0 Update

Update 10/01: The Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma 1.1.0 update is now available worldwide for Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC. Please see the updated patch notes below.

Features


 Adventuring

  • Added four extremely difficult boss gauntlets which you can challenge after completing the main quest “Guardians of Azuma.”

Village Life

  • Added a new development zone to Summer Village which you can access after reaching Village Level 8.
  • Upon reaching Village Level 10, the maximum number of facilities you can place has increased by 5, and the maximum number of decorations you can place is now 256 across the board.
  • Expanded the Storage Box capacity from 810 to 1,200.
  • Expanded the Seeds & Such capacity from 300 to 400.
  • Tsubame’s Early Bird Boutique will now sell Chocolate after you reach a certain Village Level.
  • Added sorting functionality to the VillageBuilding menus, forging menus at blacksmiths, and building menus at carpenters.

Socializing

  • Increased the maximum Bond Level to 100.
  • You will earn various recipes and items at certain Bond Levels for each character.

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a bug where villagers tasked with farming would sometimes harvest crops even when the action was set to Off.
  • Fixed bugs related to some NPC conversations during festivals and contests.
  • Additional minor bug fixes.

Have you tried out this game yet? Which version of the game are you playing? Let us know in the comments.

[source marvelous-usa.com, via gematsu.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Marvel Cosmic Invasion Demo Datamine Leaks More Heroes
item.content:encoded:
An all-star roster

The beat 'em up MARVEL Cosmic Invasion is on its way to the Switch and Switch 2 this year, and earlier on it got a demo on Steam.

It allows players to jump into the action with multiple iconic heroes and try out this new title before its official launch. That's not all, though, as there's apparently been a datamine - seemingly revealing (spoiler alert) Iron Man and Phoenix will be playable characters. There also seems to be possible roster DLC planned.

When this news is shared officially, we'll let you know. These characters would join a cast already made up of characters such as She-Hulk, Rocket Raccoon, Venom, Phyla-Vell, Spider-Man, Storm, Wolverine, Nova, and Captain America.

There's no mention of this demo releasing on other platforms, but if we hear any updates, we'll let you know.

What do you think of this leak? Let us know in the comments.

[source reddit.com, via nintendoeverything.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: More Super Mario Galaxy And Super Mario Galaxy 2 Tracks Join Nintendo Music
item.content:encoded:
Celebrating the Switch release

Nintendo is celebrating the return of Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 in all sorts of ways, and apart from the enhanced releases for the Switch, it also recently updated Nintendo Music with the second game's soundtrack.

Now, alongside today's launch of Switch release, it's added some additional tracks to its music app for Switch Online subscribers. This includes the Super Mario Galaxy 'Good Night' track and the Super Mario Galaxy 2 tracks 'Twins' and 'Special Someone' (via social media).

This follows an update to the music app earlier this week, which added the Princess Peach: Showtime! album. The Nintendo Music app also has the original Super Mario Galaxy soundtrack available. Additionally, Nintendo has released Galaxy-themed Switch Online icons, with Wave 2 now live.

What do you think of the latest update for Nintendo Music? Tell us in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: The Nintendo Museum Now Has An Official Book
item.content:encoded:
Available at the museum Art Gallery

If you end up taking a trip to the Nintendo Museum in Japan any time soon, you'll be able to purchase an official museum book.

The 'Nintendo Museum Official Book Vol. 01' goes on sale at the museum's Art Gallery on 2nd October 2025 (that's today!) and is priced at 1,650 yen. It features an "in-depth guide to the museum" and also celebrates Super Mario's 40th anniversary.

Notably, there's an "English Version" of the book available, and it's the first volume – so there's seemingly more to come. Here's the official announcement, along with a look at the cover featuring Super Mario Bros. World 1-1.

Beginning Thursday, October 2, the Nintendo Museum Official Book Vol. 1 will be available for purchase at the Art Gallery located on the 2nd floor of Exhibition Building 1. This exclusive publication offers an in-depth guide to the museum and includes special features celebrating the 40th anniversary of Super Mario Bros. *Please note that only cashless payments are accepted.

If we hear any significant updates about this book or future volumes, we'll let you know. Once again, it's available directly from the museum's Art Gallery. This news follows Nintendo's recent Art Gallery opening at the museum, which features art from Mario's games.

There'll also be a "limited-time" lighting display at the Nintendo Museum. It's taking place this December and will include a special installation featuring the Mario 40th anniversary logo.

Would you be interested in this book? Let us know in the comments.

[source x.com, via gonintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.
